climbs.name: The Phoenix
climbs.fa: (TR) Ray Jardine and John Lakey, April 1976, FFA (Lead) Mark Hudon, May 1978

content.description:
"The Phoenix" sits high on the wall, west of Cascade Falls.

This awesome crack is the first 5.13a recorded.
content.location: From the west side of Tamarack Creek Bridge, 2 miles west of Hwy 120/140 junction. Walk down to a flat area, cross a stream and continue to the brink of the cliff, rappel to the base of the crack.

content.description: Start at the base of water. Move up delicate fingers. Gear is very tricky, yellow TCU fixed closer to top.
content.protection: Small pieces up to .75 Camalot. A pad is good to keep your shoes dry at start.
content.location:
Park at Cascade Creek pull-off. Hike up creek 300 yds, stay to the left of the creek as you ascend gully. Follow slab down to base of climb. Meltdown is the obvious tips crack next to pool. Waterfall will keep you from going too

far.
